member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.SortingFilteringCollection`1
member.summary: The SortingFilteringCollection class provides efficient, reusable sorting and filtering based on a configurable sort comparer, filter predicate, and associate change events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.RaiseAsyncRunLoopEnded
member.summary: Raises the AsyncRunLoopEnded event. This method must be called by derived classes when the asynchronous run loop they start has stopped running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeInitialize
member.summary: Gives derived classes an opportunity to do work before any components are initialized. Note that the base implementation sets IsActive to true, so derived classes should either call the base implementation or set IsActive to true by their own means.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeRun
member.summary: Gives derived classes an opportunity to do work just before the run loop is begun. Implementations may also return false to prevent the run loop from starting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Exit
member.summary: When implemented in a derived, ends the active run loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.RunLoop
member.summary: When implemented in a derived, starts the run loop and blocks until it has ended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.StartRunLoop
member.summary: When implemented in a derived, starts the run loop and returns immediately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeUpdate(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Gives derived classes an opportunity to do work just before Update is called for all IUpdatable components. Returning false from this method will result in this round of Update calls being skipped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Gives derived classes an opportunity to do work just before Draw is called for all IDrawable components. Returning false from this method will result in this round of Draw calls being skipped.

Frame timing is generally handled by the Game class, but some platforms still handle it elsewhere. Once all platforms rely on the Game class's functionality, this method and any overrides should be removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter
member.summary: Represents a 3D audio emitter. Used to simulate 3D audio effects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new AudioEmitter instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.DopplerScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scale applied to the Doppler effect between the AudioEmitter and an AudioListener.

remarks.para: Defaults to 1.0
A value of 1.0 leaves the Doppler effect unmodified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.Forward
member.summary: Gets or sets the emitter's forward vector.

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Forward. (new Vector3(0, 0, -1))
Used with AudioListener.Velocity to calculate Doppler values.
The Forward and Up values must be orthonormal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of this emitter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.Up
member.summary: Gets or sets the emitter's Up vector.

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Up. (new Vector3(0, -1, 1)).
The Up and Forward vectors must be orthonormal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the emitter's velocity vector.

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Zero.
This value is only used when calculating Doppler values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener
member.summary: Represents a 3D audio listener. Used when simulating 3D Audio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener.Forward
member.summary: Gets or sets the listener's forward vector.

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Forward. (new Vector3(0, 0, -1))
Used with AudioListener.Velocity and AudioEmitter.Velocity to calculate Doppler values.
The Forward and Up vectors must be orthonormal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the listener's position.
member.remarks: Defaults to Vector3.Zero.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener.Up
member.summary: Gets or sets the listener's up vector..

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Up (New Vector3(0, -1, 0)).
Used with AudioListener.Velocity and AudioEmitter.Velocity to calculate Doppler values.
The values of the Forward and Up vectors must be orthonormal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the listener's velocity vector.

remarks.para: Defaults to Vector3.Zero.
Scaled by DopplerScale to calculate the Doppler effect value applied to a Cue.
This value is only used to calculate Doppler values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.InstancePlayLimitException
member.summary: The exception thrown when the system attempts to play more SoundEffectInstances than allotted.
member.remarks: Most platforms have a hard limit on how many sounds can be played simultaneously. This exception is thrown when that limit is exceeded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.NoAudioHardwareException
member.summary: The exception thrown when no audio hardware is present, or driver issues are detected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.NoAudioHardwareException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.param: The exception that is the underlying cause of the current exception. If not null, the current exception is raised in a try/catch block that handled the innerException.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect
member.summary: Represents a loaded sound resource.

remarks.para: A SoundEffect represents the buffer used to hold audio data and metadata. SoundEffectInstances are used to play from SoundEffects. Multiple SoundEffectinstance objects can be created and played from the same SoundEffect object.
The only limit on the number of loaded SoundEffects is restricted by available memory. When a SoundEffect is disposed, all SoundEffectInstances created from it will become invalid.
SoundEffect.Play() can be used for 'fire and forget' sounds. If advanced playback controls like volume or pitch is required, use SoundEffect.CreateInstance().

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioChannels,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Offset, in bytes, to the starting position of the audio data.
Amount, in bytes, of audio data.
The position, in samples, where the audio should begin looping.
The duration, in samples, that audio should loop over.
member.remarks: Use SoundEffect.GetSampleDuration() to convert time to samples.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.Finalize
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates a new SoundEffectInstance for this SoundEffect.
member.returns: A new SoundEffectInstance for this SoundEffect.
member.remarks: Creating a SoundEffectInstance before calling SoundEffectInstance.Play() allows you to access advanced playback features, such as volume, pitch, and 3D positioning.

member.summary: Creates a SoundEffect object based on the specified data stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.Play
member.summary: Gets an internal SoundEffectInstance and plays it.
member.returns: True if a SoundEffectInstance was successfully played, false if not.

remarks.para: Play returns false if more SoundEffectInstances are currently playing then the platform allows.
To loop a sound or apply 3D effects, call SoundEffect.CreateInstance() and SoundEffectInstance.Play() instead.
SoundEffectInstances used by SoundEffect.Play() are pooled internally.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.Play(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets an internal SoundEffectInstance and plays it with the specified volume, pitch, and panning.
member.returns: True if a SoundEffectInstance was successfully created and played, false if not.
member.param: Volume, ranging from 0.0 (silence) to 1.0 (full volume). Volume during playback is scaled by SoundEffect.MasterVolume.
Pitch adjustment, ranging from -1.0 (down an octave) to 0.0 (no change) to 1.0 (up an octave).
Panning, ranging from -1.0 (left speaker) to 0.0 (centered), 1.0 (right speaker).

remarks.para: Play returns false if more SoundEffectInstances are currently playing then the platform allows.
To apply looping or simulate 3D audio, call SoundEffect.CreateInstance() and SoundEffectInstance.Play() instead.
SoundEffectInstances used by SoundEffect.Play() are pooled internally.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources held by this .
member.param: If set to true, Dispose was called explicitly.
member.remarks: If the disposing parameter is true, the Dispose method was called explicitly. This means that managed objects referenced by this instance should be disposed or released as required. If the disposing parameter is false, Dispose was called by the finalizer and no managed objects should be touched because we do not know if they are still valid or not at that time. Unmanaged resources should always be released.

member.summary: Gets or sets the asset name of the SoundEffect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.MasterVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the master volume scale applied to all SoundEffectInstances.

remarks.para: Each SoundEffectInstance has its own Volume property that is independent to SoundEffect.MasterVolume. During playback SoundEffectInstance.Volume is multiplied by SoundEffect.MasterVolume.
This property is used to adjust the volume on all current and newly created SoundEffectInstances. The volume of an individual SoundEffectInstance can be adjusted on its own.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.DistanceScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of distance calculations.

remarks.para: DistanceScale defaults to 1.0 and must be greater than 0.0.
Higher values reduce the rate of falloff between the sound and listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.DopplerScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of Doppler calculations applied to sounds.

remarks.para: DopplerScale defaults to 1.0 and must be greater or equal to 0.0
Affects the relative velocity of emitters and listeners.
Higher values more dramatically shift the pitch for the given relative velocity of the emitter and listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.SpeedOfSound
member.summary: Returns the speed of sound used when calculating the Doppler effect..

remarks.para: Defaults to 343.5. Value is measured in meters per second.
Has no effect on distance attenuation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.Cue.GetVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a cue-instance variable value based on its friendly name.
member.returns: Value of the variable.

remarks.para: Cue-instance variables are useful when multiple instantiations of a single cue (and its associated sounds) are required (for example, a "car" cue where there may be more than one car at any given time). While a global variable allows multiple audio elements to be controlled in unison, a cue instance variable grants discrete control of each instance of a cue, even for each copy of the same cue.
The friendly name is a value set from the designer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.Cue.Apply3D(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioListener,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter)
member.summary: Updates the simulated 3D Audio settings calculated between an AudioEmitter and AudioListener.

remarks.para: This must be called before Play().

Calling this method automatically converts the sound to monoaural and sets the speaker mix for any sound played by this cue to a value calculated with the listener's and emitter's positions. Any stereo information in the sound will be discarded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.EnvironmentMapAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the environment map RGB that will be blended over the base texture. Range 0 to 1, default 1. If set to zero, the RGB channels of the environment map will completely ignored (but the environment map alpha may still be visible if EnvironmentMapSpecular is greater than zero).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.EnvironmentMapSpecular
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the environment map alpha channel that will be added to the base texture. Range 0 to 1, default 0. This can be used to implement cheap specular lighting, by encoding one or more specular highlight patterns into the environment map alpha channel, then setting EnvironmentMapSpecular to the desired specular light color.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.FresnelFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Fresnel factor used for the environment map blending. Higher values make the environment map only visible around the silhouette edges of the object, while lower values make it visible everywhere. Setting this property to 0 disables Fresnel entirely, making the environment map equally visible regardless of view angle. The default is 1. Fresnel only affects the environment map RGB (the intensity of which is controlled by EnvironmentMapAmount). The alpha contribution (controlled by EnvironmentMapSpecular) is not affected by the Fresnel setting.

member.summary: This effect requires lighting, so we explicitly implement IEffectLights.LightingEnabled, and do not allow turning it off.

member.summary: Renders the vertices as a single polyline; the count may be any positive integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.None
member.summary: No gestures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.Tap
member.summary: The user touched a single point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.DragComplete
member.summary: States completion of a drag gesture(VerticalDrag, HorizontalDrag, or FreeDrag).
member.remarks: No position or delta information is available for this sample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.Flick
member.summary: States that a touch was combined with a quick swipe.
member.remarks: Flicks does not contain position information. The velocity of it can be read from

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.FreeDrag
member.summary: The use touched a point and then performed a free-form drag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.Hold
member.summary: The use touched a single point for approximately one second.
member.remarks: As this is a single event, it will not be contionusly fired while the user is holding the touch-point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.HorizontalDrag
member.summary: The user touched the screen and performed either left to right or right to left drag gesture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.Pinch
member.summary: The user either converged or diverged two touch-points on the screen which is like a two-finger drag.
member.remarks: When this gesture-type is enabled and two fingers are down, it takes precedence over drag gestures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.PinchComplete
member.summary: An in-progress pinch operation was completed.
member.remarks: No position or delta information is available for this sample.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.DoubleTap
member.summary: The user tapped the device twice which is always preceded by a Tap gesture.
member.remarks: If the time between two touchs are long enough, insted two seperate single Tap gestures will be generated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.GestureType.VerticalDrag
member.summary: The user touched the screen and performed either top to bottom or bottom to top drag gesture.
